etymology.description: 小 (small) + 费 (expense/fee) = a small fee given as a tip.
etymology.interpretation: Refers to a modest additional payment given to service staff as a gratuity. Emphasizes a small expense beyond the main bill.
etymology.simplification: Traditional 費 was simplified to 费 by replacing 貝 with 贝 and merging strokes around the phonetic 弗 to reduce complexity; 小 is unchanged.

examples.chinese: 在餐厅用餐后，我们给服务员小费(在餐廳用餐後，我們給服務員小費)。
examples.pinyin: Zài cāntīng yòngcān hòu, wǒmen gěi fúwùyuán xiǎofèi.
examples.english: After dining at the restaurant, we give the waiter a tip.

examples.chinese: 在一些国家，给小费是习惯(在一些國家，給小費是習慣)。
examples.pinyin: Zài yīxiē guójiā, gěi xiǎofèi shì xíguàn.
examples.english: In some countries, tipping is customary.

examples.chinese: 这家餐厅自动收取服务费，不必另付小费(這家餐廳自動收取服務費，不必另付小費)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā cāntīng zìdòng shōuqǔ fúwùfèi, búbì lìng fù xiǎofèi.
examples.english: This restaurant automatically charges a service fee, so you don't need to pay an additional tip.
